<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/biden-propose-6t-budget?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hey, Big Spender
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/biden-propose-6t-budget" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the White House in front of a teal background. A large, rolled up receipt that unfurls to the edge of the picture sits at the base of the building's entrance.  " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjY1L3doaXRlX2hvdXNlX2J1ZGdldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This morning, President Biden will send Congress a jumbo-sized $6 trillion budget for FY2022, the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/27/business/economy/biden-plan.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> yesterday. If it passes, federal spending will eclipse records set during WWII.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">AP Gov detour: </strong>Funding for each fiscal year, which runs Oct.–Sept., is technically hammered out through 12 appropriations bills passed by Congress and signed by the president. What Biden will release today (as is tradition in a president's first year) is more a map of Democrats’ spending priorities for the next decade. Congress is free to toss it in the recycling bin if it chooses.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's inside? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Enough mentions of the t-word to make Republicans woozy. The budget <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/what-watch-bidens-first-full-budget-medicaid-environment-pentagon-spending-2021-05-27/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">includes</a> March's $1.9 trillion pandemic stimulus plus several of Biden's major proposals: the $2.3 trillion American Jobs plan, the $1.8 trillion American Families Plan, and $1.5 trillion in discretionary spending increases. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The budget is also expected to outline additional policy proposals like...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A public health insurance option</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Funds to get women back into the workforce </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Costs tied to the withdrawal from Afghanistan</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/05/26/biden-budget-military-cyber-force-490965?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Expanding</a></span><span> the US Cyber Command to meet growing cyber threats</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden's budget will reportedly increase federal spending to $8.2 trillion/year by 2031, which would require running annual deficits of $1.3+ trillion, including a $1.8 trillion deficit in 2022. Biden's proposal to pay for most of this new spending with <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/16/checking-bidens-tax-proposals?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tax increases</a> (including a 28% corporate rate) faces challenges from Republicans, some Democrats, and some executives.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not the only new bill on Capitol Hill</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, GOP senators <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/biden-infrastructure-plan-capito-discusses-republican-counteroffer.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a $928 billion counteroffer to Biden's infrastructure package, more than half of which would go to roads and bridges. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the bill falls short of funding goals for several of Biden’s priorities—particularly investments in rail, public transit, and clean energy—the White House said it's big enough to continue negotiations into next week, which means blowing past Biden's original Memorial Day deadline to pass an infrastructure deal.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINTECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/acorns-plans-spac-ipo-amidst-talks-regulation?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Acorns Didn't Come to Make Friends, It Came to SPAC
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/acorns-plans-spac-ipo-amidst-talks-regulation" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Acorns app on iPhone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjY3L2Fjb3Jucy5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Katherine Mayhew/Acorns</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Acorns, the investing app Ashton Kutcher is obsessed with, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/acorns-to-go-public-through-a-blank-check-merger-valued-at-2point2b.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced plans</a> to go public via SPAC yesterday in a deal valued at $2+ billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Robinhood is your cool cousin who made $50k on her GameStop stock, Acorns is your quiet uncle who owns a profitable pet food business in the suburbs. Acorns doesn't allow its 6.8+ million users to buy or sell individual stocks. Instead, it helps them build balanced portfolios for the long term via its signature service, which deposits users' spare change into index funds. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Acorns will be on the right side of history," CEO Noah Kerner told the WSJ. "We are not a grow-at-all-costs company."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out on SPACs:</strong> So far in 2021, SPACs have raised $17 billion more than 2020's total haul. But even the biggest name in SPACs, Chamath Palihapitiya, wants more <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-05-27/spacs-can-take-away-the-insiders-advantage-in-ipos-and-markets?utm_source=url_link&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oversight</a> of the process. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He might not have to wait long. SEC Chairman Gary Gensler said yesterday that the agency is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/sec-considers-new-investor-protections-for-spacs.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beefing up</a> resources to look into the SPAC boom, which many fintechs like Acorns have taken advantage of.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/disneys-cruella-signals-pivot-pg13?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Does Cruella Get to Say the F-Word?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/disneys-cruella-signals-pivot-pg13" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Emma Stone saying "I'm Cruella"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9ayXNVkco6fM6YUNPU/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Emma Stone saying " I'm Cruella"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/9ayXNVkco6fM6YUNPU/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Disney's live-action <em>Cruella</em> arrives in theaters and on Disney+. But if you're looking forward to cute puppies, you might be surprised by this dark origin story of the iconic villain. While the 1996 version of <em>101 Dalmatians</em> was rated G, this retelling is rated PG-13.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Nobody wants a G.</strong> <em>Cruella</em> is Disney's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-disneys-cruella-shows-the-decline-of-the-g-rated-movie-11622068924?mod=hp_listc_pos4" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">third PG-13 release</a> in a year, according to the WSJ. And if family-friendly Disney is leaning into “extended violence and smoking,” you know the rest of the industry is trending that direction…and has been for a while. By the 2000s, PG-13 movies were raking in most of the box office revenue. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Between 2010–2019, PG-13 movies grossed $54.6 billion. In the same time span, PG movies earned $24.3 billion; R movies, $26.5 billion; and G movies, $2.7 billion, according to Comscore.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> PG-13 has become the sweet spot for Disney to appeal to a broader audience interested in violent Marvel films, live-action remakes of its classics, and new projects like <em>Hamilton</em>.</p>

SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll tell you what, it isn’t a new flavor of pre-workout. (Well, honestly they might be happy about that, but it’s not the point of this ad.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These dudes are beaming because <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-tc-3?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-totalconviction3&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210167&psource=esamnbwdg0210167&wsource=esamnbwdg0210167" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool’s legendary cofounders</a> have just chosen a stock that has garnered the extremely rare designation of <strong style="color:#000">“Total Conviction” Buy Alert</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They think this stock has the ability to change advertising as we know it—thought that was our job, but whatever—using new technology called programmatic. It’s like matchmaking for advertisers and new customers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And this stock pick, which is only available to members of <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-tc-3?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-totalconviction3&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210167&psource=esamnbwdg0210167&wsource=esamnbwdg0210167" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motley Fool Stock Advisor</a>, may be poised to potentially make significant gains this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, it’s in good company, because other stocks that TMF’s cofounders have agreed on have beaten the S&P by 13x.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ready to be as pumped as two BFFs hitting PRs on bench? <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-tc-3?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-totalconviction3&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210167&psource=esamnbwdg0210167&wsource=esamnbwdg0210167" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up for Motley Fool Stock Advisor today</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/key-performance-indicators-may-28?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/27/key-performance-indicators-may-28" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Adam Neumann" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNzg4L2FkYW1fbmV1bWFubi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Kelly Sullivan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stats: </strong>A few <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/former-wework-chiefs-gargantuan-exit-package-gets-new-sweetener-11622115000?mod=hp_lead_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stunning numbers</a> about what transpired at WeWork, based on new reporting by the WSJ:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2019, the company gave CEO Adam Neumann an enhanced exit package worth about $245 million to get him out the door before it tried to go public.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>During Neumann’s tenure, WeWork paid $759 million across 10 investments. It eventually sold those stakes for $164 million.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company has raised a total of more than $11 billion, though it was last valued at $7.9 billion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>"It's not true that the Super League is dead because the concept is still alive."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Javier Tebas, the president of Spanish soccer's La Liga, is <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/92b0b103-b0d7-418e-b5a4-391dd2e33d67?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not giving up</a> on the concept of a European "Super League," which fizzled embarrassingly in less than 48 hours last month. While nine teams backed out, three powerhouses—Juventus, Barcelona, and Real Madrid—are still committed to the idea.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>A deep dive into the Citizen app, which critics say is promoting vigilantism. (<a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/y3dpyw/inside-crime-app-citizen-vigilante?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motherboard</a>, language warning) </p>

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A few weeks ago, we asked you about your Memorial Day weekend plans, because it seemed like a fun thing to do. Here are some of our favorite responses: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Going to take my 94-year-old mother to Eagle, CO, to visit my sister for the weekend. First time on a plane since Covid!"—Ellen L.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I will be taking an extravagant trip to my WFH setup so I can study for the bar!"—Adam G.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I am coming home from a deployment to Iraq and Syria. A staycation with my family is all I want and to take a day to remember all those we have lost. Some of them my friends."—Matt L.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I'm traveling to visit my aunt and uncle at their lake house for Memorial Day. It will be their first time meeting our baby girl!"—Matthew A.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Still searching for a friend in the Hamptons since I've moved to NYC...I have to settle with heading to my friends at the Jersey shore for MDW, if that counts as traveling."—Carli A.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Going to the promised land of Moses Lake, WA! I dare you to feature it. Wakeboarder paradise."—Dare accepted, Jonathan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I'm going to a lake house in Tennessee with Hinge boy and his pals <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> for Memorial Day. What a time."—Sara R.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I'm going to wake up at 11am, watch TikToks for two hours, and then write about the stock market for the media company I work for. Maybe make an oven pizza?"—Matty M.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Follow Friday: </strong><a href="https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQwFuQLnLocj5F7ZcmcuWYQ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MetaBallStudios</a> on YouTube specializes in size comparisons, so if you're ever wondering how <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aTPwbVqU6lc" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fictional starships</a> stack up against one another, this is your channel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cookout recipes: </strong>Everyone knows Memorial Day is peak grilling season. A large, rolled up receipt that unfurls to the edge of the picture sits at the base of the building's entrance.  \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MjY1L3doaXRlX2hvdXNlX2J1ZGdldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis morning, President Biden will send Congress a jumbo-sized $6 trillion budget for FY2022, the NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/27/business/economy/biden-plan.html?action=click\u0026module=Spotlight\u0026pgtype=Homepage\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. If it passes, federal spending will eclipse records set during WWII.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAP Gov detour: \u003c/strong\u003eFunding for each fiscal year, which runs Oct.–Sept., is technically hammered out through 12 appropriations bills passed by Congress and signed by the president. What Biden will release today (as is tradition in a president's first year) is more a map of Democrats’ spending priorities for the next decade. Congress is free to toss it in the recycling bin if it chooses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's inside? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnough mentions of the t-word to make Republicans woozy. The budget \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/what-watch-bidens-first-full-budget-medicaid-environment-pentagon-spending-2021-05-27/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincludes\u003c/a\u003e March's $1.9 trillion pandemic stimulus plus several of Biden's major proposals: the $2.3 trillion American Jobs plan, the $1.8 trillion American Families Plan, and $1.5 trillion in discretionary spending increases. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe budget is also expected to outline additional policy proposals like...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA public health insurance option\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFunds to get women back into the workforce \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCosts tied to the withdrawal from Afghanistan\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2021/05/26/biden-budget-military-cyber-force-490965?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eExpanding\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the US Cyber Command to meet growing cyber threats\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden's budget will reportedly increase federal spending to $8.2 trillion/year by 2031, which would require running annual deficits of $1.3+ trillion, including a $1.8 trillion deficit in 2022. Biden's proposal to pay for most of this new spending with \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/16/checking-bidens-tax-proposals?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etax increases\u003c/a\u003e (including a 28% corporate rate) faces challenges from Republicans, some Democrats, and some executives.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot the only new bill on Capitol Hill\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, GOP senators \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/biden-infrastructure-plan-capito-discusses-republican-counteroffer.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a $928 billion counteroffer to Biden's infrastructure package, more than half of which would go to roads and bridges. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile the bill falls short of funding goals for several of Biden’s priorities—particularly investments in rail, public transit, and clean energy—the White House said it's big enough to continue negotiations into next week, which means blowing past Biden's original Memorial Day deadline to collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAcorns, the investing app Ashton Kutcher is obsessed with, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/acorns-to-go-public-through-a-blank-check-merger-valued-at-2point2b.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced plans\u003c/a\u003e to go public via SPAC yesterday in a deal valued at $2+ billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf Robinhood is your cool cousin who made $50k on her GameStop stock, Acorns is your quiet uncle who owns a profitable pet food business in the suburbs. Acorns doesn't allow its 6.8+ million users to buy or sell individual stocks. Instead, it helps them build balanced portfolios for the long term via its signature service, which deposits users' spare change into index funds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Acorns will be on the right side of history,\" CEO Noah Kerner told the WSJ. \"We are not a grow-at-all-costs company.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out on SPACs:\u003c/strong\u003e So far in 2021, SPACs have raised $17 billion more than 2020's total haul. But even the biggest name in SPACs, Chamath Palihapitiya, wants more \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-05-27/spacs-can-take-away-the-insiders-advantage-in-ipos-and-markets?utm_source=url_link\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoversight\u003c/a\u003e of the process. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe might not have to wait long. SEC Chairman Gary Gensler said yesterday that the agency is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/27/sec-considers-new-investor-protections-for-spacs.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeefing up\u003c/a\u003e resources to look into the SPAC boom, which width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, Disney's live-action \u003cem\u003eCruella\u003c/em\u003e arrives in theaters and on Disney+. But if you're looking forward to cute puppies, you might be surprised by this dark origin story of the iconic villain. While the 1996 version of \u003cem\u003e101 Dalmatians\u003c/em\u003e was rated G, this retelling is rated PG-13.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNobody wants a G.\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cem\u003eCruella\u003c/em\u003e is Disney's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-disneys-cruella-shows-the-decline-of-the-g-rated-movie-11622068924?mod=hp_listc_pos4\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethird PG-13 release\u003c/a\u003e in a year, according to the WSJ. And if family-friendly Disney is leaning into “extended violence and smoking,” you know the rest of the industry is trending that direction…and has been for a while. By the 2000s, PG-13 movies were raking in most of the box office revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBetween 2010–2019, PG-13 movies grossed $54.6 billion. In the same time span, PG movies earned $24.3 billion; R movies, $26.5 billion; and G movies, $2.7 billion, according to Comscore.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e PG-13 has become the sweet spot for Disney to appeal to a broader audience interested in violent Marvel films, live-action remakes of its classics, and new projects like \u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS \u003c/strong\u003eA few \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/former-wework-chiefs-gargantuan-exit-package-gets-new-sweetener-11622115000?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estunning numbers\u003c/a\u003e about what transpired at WeWork, based on new reporting by the WSJ:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2019, the company gave CEO Adam Neumann an enhanced exit package worth about $245 million to get him out the door before it tried to go public.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDuring Neumann’s tenure, WeWork paid $759 million across 10 investments. It eventually sold those stakes for $164 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company has raised a total of more than $11 billion, though it was last valued at $7.9 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuote: \u003c/strong\u003e\"It's not true that the Super League is dead because the concept is still alive.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJavier Tebas, the president of Spanish soccer's La Liga, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/92b0b103-b0d7-418e-b5a4-391dd2e33d67?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot giving up\u003c/a\u003e on the concept of a European \"Super League,\" which fizzled embarrassingly in less than 48 hours last month. While nine teams backed out, three powerhouses—Juventus, Barcelona, and Real Madrid—are still committed to the idea.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead: \u003c/strong\u003eA deep dive into the Citizen app, which critics say is promoting vigilantism. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA few weeks ago, we asked you about your Memorial Day weekend plans, because it seemed like a fun thing to do. Here are some of our favorite responses: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Going to take my 94-year-old mother to Eagle, CO, to visit my sister for the weekend. First time on a plane since Covid!\"—Ellen L.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I will be taking an extravagant trip to my WFH setup so I can study for the bar!\"—Adam G.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I am coming home from a deployment to Iraq and Syria. A staycation with my family is all I want and to take a day to remember all those we have lost. Some of them my friends.\"—Matt L.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I'm traveling to visit my aunt and uncle at their lake house for Memorial Day. It will be their first time meeting our baby girl!\"—Matthew A.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Still searching for a friend in the Hamptons since I've moved to NYC...I have to settle with heading to my friends at the Jersey shore for MDW, if that counts as traveling.\"—Carli A.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"Going to the promised land of Moses Lake, WA! I dare you to feature it. Wakeboarder paradise.\"—Dare accepted, Jonathan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I'm going to a lake house in Tennessee with Hinge boy and his pals \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/dancer_1f483.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e for Memorial Day. What a time.\"—Sara R.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"I'm going to wake up at 11am, watch TikToks for two hours, and then write about the stock market for the media company I work for.
